<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and all assume that the caller and callee prototype exactly match.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Callee is responsible for stack cleaning. MSVC uses this by default for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// methods in its ABI.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca97109ccd68cac64fb38dbd24fc4589c6"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca97109ccd68cac64fb38dbd24fc4589c6">X86&#95;ThisCall</a> = 70,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Call to a PTX kernel. Passes all arguments in parameter space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae60325da71f0576e18cc0e5dd7e8afb6"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae60325da71f0576e18cc0e5dd7e8afb6">PTX&#95;Kernel</a> = 71,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Call to a PTX device function. Passes all arguments in register or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// parameter space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca9b03ea185599539f24eb1f467627c111"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca9b03ea185599539f24eb1f467627c111">PTX&#95;Device</a> = 72,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Used for SPIR non-kernel device functions. No lowering or expansion of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// arguments. Structures are passed as a pointer to a struct with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// byval attribute. Functions can only call SPIR&#95;FUNC and SPIR&#95;KERNEL</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// functions. Functions can only have zero or one return values. Variable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// arguments are not allowed, except for printf. How arguments/return</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// values are lowered are not specified. Functions are only visible to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// devices.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4caacadec9c4ef27d184bcbbea409afebb2"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4caacadec9c4ef27d184bcbbea409afebb2">SPIR&#95;FUNC</a> = 75,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Used for SPIR kernel functions. Inherits the restrictions of SPIR&#95;FUNC,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// except it cannot have non-void return values, it cannot have variable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// arguments, it can also be called by the host or it is externally</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// visible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca9b5e79699935bf721647d44339701860"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca9b5e79699935bf721647d44339701860">SPIR&#95;KERNEL</a> = 76,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The C convention as specified in the x86-64 supplement to the System V</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// ABI, used on most non-Windows systems.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca10f11fb587acddab17f3ad85eb698fbe"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca10f11fb587acddab17f3ad85eb698fbe">X86&#95;64&#95;SysV</a> = 78,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The C convention as implemented on Windows/x86-64 and AArch64. It</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// differs from the more common \\c X86&#95;64&#95;SysV convention in a number of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// ways, most notably in that XMM registers used to pass arguments are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// shadowed by GPRs, and vice versa. On AArch64, this is identical to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// normal C (AAPCS) calling convention for normal functions, but floats are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// passed in integer registers to variadic functions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae41511c1ad4197da36cef403f34bac72"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae41511c1ad4197da36cef403f34bac72">Win64</a> = 79,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// MSVC calling convention that passes vectors and vector aggregates in SSE</Highlight></CodeLine>
